--- title: "Working with Data" format: revealjs: theme: night embed-resources: true standalone: true editor: visual execute: echo: false --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {style="font-size: 4em; color: #FFFFFF;"} Tidy Data ::: ![Expected layout of "tidy" datasets](images/tidy-1.png) ## ::: {style="font-size: 3em; color: #FFFFFF;"} There's Data :::
Gender stereotypes in 5-7 year old children

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
subject sex age trait target stereotype high_achieve_caution
64 male 7 nice adults 0.25 0.50
107 male 7 smart children 0.25 0.50
23 male 6 nice adults 0.75 0.75
65 male 7 smart adults 0.00 0.75
47 female 7 nice adults 1.00 0.50
59 male 7 nice adults 0.25 0.75
````` ::: ::: ::: ## ::: {style="font-size: 3em; color: #FFFFFF;"} Lots of Data ::: Body girth measurements and skeletal diameter measurements for 247 men and 260 women. ::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
age wgt hgt sex sho_gi wai_gi nav_gi hip_gi
30 93.8 192.7 1 112.2 88.3 93.5 105.0
44 87.7 177.8 1 120.4 98.0 101.8 101.5
55 87.3 179.1 1 122.4 98.0 98.0 99.6
24 74.5 182.4 1 115.0 76.8 80.0 94.5
37 52.7 156.0 0 97.4 69.0 76.3 86.7
20 69.0 168.9 0 104.5 75.0 95.0 104.9
````` ::: ::: ::: ## ::: {style="font-size: 3em; color: #FFFFFF;"} In Every Context :::
NBA player of the week from 1985 to 2016

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Age Date Draft Year Height Player Position
24 Jan 12, 2015 2011 6-1 Kemba Walker G
26 Feb 26, 1989 1985 7-0 Patrick Ewing C
26 Nov 4, 1984 1981 6-10 Larry Nance PF
24 Dec 3, 2012 2007 6-9 Kevin Durant SF
31 Mar 27, 1994 1984 7-0 Kevin Willis C
24 Nov 12, 1995 1993 6-7 Penny Hardaway PG
````` ::: ::: ::: ## ::: {style="font-size: 3em; color: #FFFFFF;"} You Can Imagine :::
Fish Sampled on Blackfoot River

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
trip mark length weight year section species
1 0 422 640 2004 ScottyBrown RBT
2 1 391 NA 1998 ScottyBrown WCT
1 0 275 220 2004 Johnsrud RBT
1 0 220 90 2002 Johnsrud Brown
1 0 374 360 1989 ScottyBrown RBT
1 0 219 100 1990 Johnsrud RBT
````` ::: ::: ::: ## {background-color="#B6CADA"} ::: {style="font-size: 3em; color: #000000;"} Your Turn ::: ::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"} Every year, the US releases to the public a large data set containing information on births recorded in the country. A total of 13 variables were collected on every birth, including information about: - the birth (baby weight, sex of baby, premie status) - the pregnancy (hospital visits, length of gestation, ) - the mother's attributes (age, smoking status, marital status, race) - the father's age ::: . . . ::: {style="color: #e28743;"} How would you expect this dataframe to look? ::: ## ::: {style="font-size: 2em; color: #FFFFFF;"} Types of Variables :::
![Diagram of types of variables we will analyze!](images/variables.png) ## ::: {style="font-size: 2em; color: #FFFFFF;"} Examples ::: - A person's height (usually) would be a **continuous, numerical** variable - The number of classes someone takes would be a **discrete, numerical** variable - A course letter grade would be a **ordinal, categorical** variable - The color of someone's hair would be a **regular, categorical** variable ## ::: {style="font-size: 3em; color: #76b5c5;"} Your Turn :::
Suppose researchers have yearly data on Elephant Seal abundance on Pedras Blancas from 2010 - 2014. . . .
::: {style="font-size: 1.5em; color: #e28743;"} What type of variable would year be? ::: ## ::: {style="font-size: 2em; color: #FFFFFF;"} Types of Studies ::: ::: columns ::: {.column width="40%"} *Experiment* - randomization - replication - controlling - blocking ::: ::: {.column width="5%"} ::: ::: {.column width="55%"} *Observational Study* - collect data in a way that does not directly interfere with how the data arise ::: ::: ## ::: {style="font-size: 2em; color: #FFFFFF;"} Relationships Between Variables :::
explanatory variable $\rightarrow$ *might affect* $\rightarrow$ response variable . . . - If two variables are not associated, then they are said to be **independent**. - If two variables are associated, then they are said to be **dependent**. ## ::: {style="font-size: 2em; color: #FFFFFF;"} Causal Inference :::
association $\neq$ causation
. . . What do you need to say that the explanatory variable [*causes*]{style="color: #e28743;"} a change in the response variable? ## {background-color="#B6CADA"} ::: {style="font-size: 4em; color: #000000;"} Lab Warm-up ::: ## ::: {style="font-size: 2em; color: #FFFFFF;"} Data Types in `R` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="false"} glimpse(births_small) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Rows: 1,000 Columns: 10 $ fage 34, 36, 37, NA, 32, 32, 37, 29, 30, 29, 30, 34, 28, 28,… $ mage 34, 31, 36, 16, 31, 26, 36, 24, 32, 26, 34, 27, 22, 31,… $ weeks 37, 41, 37, 38, 36, 39, 36, 40, 39, 39, 42, 40, 40, 39,… $ premie "full term", "full term", "full term", "full term", "pr… $ gained 28, 41, 28, 29, 48, 45, 20, 65, 25, 22, 40, 30, 31, NA,… $ weight 6.96, 8.86, 7.51, 6.19, 6.75, 6.69, 6.13, 6.74, 8.94, 9… $ lowbirthweight "not low", "not low", "not low", "not low", "not low", … $ sex male, female, female, male, female, female, female, mal… $ habit "nonsmoker", "nonsmoker", "nonsmoker", "nonsmoker", "no… $ whitemom "white", "white", "not white", "white", "white", "white… ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: columns ::: {.column width="45%"} What do you think `dbl` means? How is that different from `int`? ::: ::: {.column width="5%"} ::: ::: {.column width="45%"} What does `chr` mean? How might it differ from `fct`? ::: :::

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
